alert.note: Alert for Pike; Walthall (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 22 at 6:07PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Walthall and southeastern Pike Counties through 645 PM CDT... At 607 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Tylertown, or 10 miles southwest of Kokomo, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Tylertown, Salem and Dexter. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for southeastern Louisiana...and southern Mississippi.
